title: Failure-Based Collaborative Learning Design for Innovation in Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: An experimental approach applying a teacher collaboration model to higher education contexts by combining online collaboration tools and offline workshops.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the importance of creative risk-taking in math lesson design by analyzing failure cases.
Learners can participate in an iterative improvement process for math instructional materials through peer feedback and collaboration.
Learners can critically evaluate the effectiveness of teaching methods by comparing actual classroom implementation data with predictive data.

resources: Digital collaboration platform (e.g., Google Workspace, Notion)
Video equipment for lesson implementation recording

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
